links.quantification: Efficient HVAC/appliances → 30-40% lower operational energy; reduces building energy intensity 150 → 90 kWh/m²/year
Irrigation pump efficiency 35% → 75% = 54% energy cost reduction for farmers; enables water pricing reform
Cold chain refrigeration efficiency → 40% lower operational cost; spoilage 40% → 15% becomes feasible
EV motor efficiency 85% → 95% = 12% range improvement per kWh; range anxiety reduced
Industrial motors 30% → 70% efficiency = 57% energy cost reduction; 120 TWh/year saved = 60 GW avoided
100 GW avoided coal capacity = 40% reduction in power sector PM2.5 emissions; 10K deaths/year avoided
Waste processing energy costs 40% reduction via efficient motors; processing capacity 100 → 180 MT/year
Municipal energy bills (street lighting, water pumps, sewage) 30-40% reduction; ₹10K Cr/year fiscal space
Upfront cost barrier: Efficient motors/appliances cost 20-40% more; builders resist, buyers lack financing
Pump replacement resistance: 20M agricultural pumps need replacement at ₹50K-1L each; farmers lack capital
Production downtime risk: Motor replacement requires 3-7 days shutdown; MSMEs can't afford order fulfillment delays
Lower energy demand → less capacity needed → lower tariffs → more ECBC adoption → further demand reduction (positive feedback)
Efficient pumps → lower farm energy cost → water pricing viable → less groundwater stress → less pumping needed (resource preservation)
Buildings impact requires: ECBC enforcement + performance disclosure + on-bill financing; without these, only 30% of potential realized
Water impact requires: Pump-as-a-service financing + groundwater regulation + subsidy swap framework
Food impact requires: Cold chain financing + last-mile logistics + market linkages; energy savings alone insufficient
Via efficient pumps: Better water availability for irrigation → 15-20% increase in crop yields for water-intensive crops; enables horticultural expansion
Via efficient motors: Reduced waste heat from vehicles → 2-3°C lower urban heat island effect in high-density areas; improves thermal comfort
Via reduced pumping: Less groundwater extraction → fewer diesel pump sets running → reduced PM2.5 and NOx emissions in rural areas
Via efficient HVAC: Less building waste heat → reduced urban heat island → 1-2°C cooling in dense neighborhoods; co-benefit of energy efficiency
Via reduced energy demand: 120 TWh industrial savings → 60 MT coal avoided → 30% reduction in industrial zone PM2.5 concentrations
Via cold chain: Reduced spoilage → fresher produce in cities → better nutrition outcomes; 25% reduction in foodborne illness in urban areas
Via improved water availability: Less water stress → more reliable building water supply → reduced need for energy-intensive water storage/pumping
Via efficient cold storage motors: Industrial cold chain energy costs -40% → enables food processing expansion in rural areas → local value addition
Via reduced HVAC energy: 40M households 30% savings → 15 TWh avoided → 7.5 MT coal not burned → PM2.5 reduction in urban airsheds
Via efficient EVs: 12% range improvement → faster EV adoption → 2M EVs by 2030 → 20% reduction in urban transport NOx emissions
